intro: Asagraea tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved asagraea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have a white or pale pink color. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a relatively rare and understudied species.
